newsitem.title: FRANCE: France to offer 1,000 men for Albania mission.
newsitem.headline: France to offer 1,000 men for Albania mission.

text.p: France is to offer 1,000 troops with armoured cars and armoured personnel carriers to join a multinational security force to protect humanitarian relief operations in Albania, the defence ministry said on Tuesday.
An aide to Defence Minister Charles Millon said Paris was offering to handle security in the port of Durres, and organise and escort supply convoys from there to the capital, Tirana.

Italy is putting together a 5,000-strong Albania force following approval from the United Nations on Friday. The force is also expected to include contingents from Greece, Spain, Romania and Portugal.

Albania wants troops from abroad to help secure ports, airports, roads and railways so that aid can be distributed. Violence has spread through Albania since January when a string of popular investment schemes collapsed, wiping out millions of dollars in savings.
The defence official said French troops could be operational in Albania within 10 days depending on planning now under way in Rome.
He added that Paris assumed the force would operate under Chapter Seven of the United Nations charter allowing troops to use force in necessary to ensure the success of their mission.
